page.title: 04Bideford:S+SE.Pollution.
page.content: A serious intrusion into the beauty of the area is made by the electricity pylons in the south and west,and the private tipping on the east bank of the Yeo,just before it's junction with the Torridge.Indiscriminate tipping of rubbish in the river,alongside the lay-bys on the A386, also adds to the pollution of the Torridge ,which already has to contend with the untreated sewage of Bideford and North- am,and industrial waste from up river. Derelict land at Kynochs,East-the-Water creates unsightliness,although much of it is being screened by wild plants,and the District Council has plans to improve the area ,with management of the adjacent saltmarsh.Heavy traffic at the height of the summer,builds up within the area,with undesirable effects.
